Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http

Class HTTPConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connection
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.LineBasedConnection
        • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.HTTPConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, H2FrameHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileHTTPConnection, PriorityAwareHTTPConnection, ServletConnection
    public class HTTPConnection
extends LineBasedConnection
implements H2FrameHandler
    Connection handler for the HTTP protocol. This manages potentially multiple requests within a single TCP connection. Provides default 404 behaviour when no specific Stream implementation is provided.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

                              boolean endStream,
                              java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Description copied from interface: H2FrameHandler
        Called when a DATA frame is received.
        Specified by:
        dataFrameReceived in interface H2FrameHandler
        Parameters:
        streamId - the stream identifier
        endStream - true if this is the last frame for the stream
        data - the data payload (a slice - consume or copy before returning)

      • headersFrameReceived

        public void headersFrameReceived​(int streamId,
                                 boolean endStream,
                                 boolean endHeaders,
                                 int streamDependency,
                                 boolean exclusive,
                                 int weight,
                                 java.nio.ByteBuffer headerBlockFragment)
        Description copied from interface: H2FrameHandler
        Called when a HEADERS frame is received.
        Specified by:
        headersFrameReceived in interface H2FrameHandler
        Parameters:
        streamId - the stream identifier
        endStream - true if this is the last frame for the stream
        endHeaders - true if this completes the header block
        streamDependency - the stream dependency (0 if no priority)
        exclusive - true for exclusive stream dependency
        weight - the priority weight (1-256, only valid if streamDependency > 0)
        headerBlockFragment - the HPACK-encoded header block (a slice)

      • priorityFrameReceived

        public void priorityFrameReceived​(int streamId,
                                  int streamDependency,
                                  boolean exclusive,
                                  int weight)
        Description copied from interface: H2FrameHandler
        Called when a PRIORITY frame is received.
        Specified by:
        priorityFrameReceived in interface H2FrameHandler
        Parameters:
        streamId - the stream identifier
        streamDependency - the stream this one depends on
        exclusive - true for exclusive dependency
        weight - the priority weight (1-256)

        Specified by:
        settingsFrameReceived in interface H2FrameHandler
        Parameters:
        ack - true if this is an acknowledgement of our SETTINGS
        settings - map of setting identifier to value (empty if ack is true)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        promisedStreamId - the stream identifier for the pushed response
        endHeaders - true if this completes the header block
        headerBlockFragment - the HPACK-encoded header block (a slice)

        Parameters:

                       int streamId,
                       java.lang.String message)
        Description copied from interface: H2FrameHandler
        Called when a protocol error is detected during frame parsing.
        Specified by:
        frameError in interface H2FrameHandler
        Parameters:
        errorCode - the HTTP/2 error code
        streamId - the stream ID where the error occurred (0 for connection-level)

      • cleanupAllStreams

        protected void cleanupAllStreams()
        Immediately cleanup all streams when the connection is closing. This prevents memory leaks on connection termination and ensures telemetry spans are properly ended.

      • removeStream

        protected org.bluezoo.gumdrop.http.Stream removeStream​(int streamId)
        Removes a stream from this connection. Subclasses can override to perform additional cleanup.
        Parameters:
        streamId - the stream ID to remove
        Returns:
        the removed stream, or null if not found
